sources.snippet: A federal court rejected class certification in a consolidated lawsuit alleging cloud-services provider Blackbaud Inc. failed to protect the personal information of more than 1.5 billion people that was exposed in a 2020 data breach and ransomware attack.

sources.title: Blackbaud to pay $6.75M to resolve California data breach claims
sources.snippet: On June 13, Blackbaud Inc. agreed to pay $6.75 million to the state of California to resolve 2020 data breach claims brought by the state's attorney general. California was the only state to sit out of a $49.5 million settlement reached with 49 states and the District of Columbia to resolve the claims in 2023.

sources.title: In re Blackbaud, Inc. Customer Data Security Breach Litigation
sources.snippet: In July 2020, Blackbaud, a South Carolina-based software company, revealed that a hacker had breached its network in May 2020. sources.snippet: Data protection laws across Europe are undergoing their first substantial changes in approximately 20 years. sources.title: What is GDPR? - Blackbaud
sources.snippet: What is GDPR? The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) is an EU law that will be enforceable from 25th May 2018, and in the UK will replace the ageing Data Protection Act.
